$Earl Torgeson and Sal Yvars had been conducting a running argument; Yvars kept complaining that Torgeson was hitting him with his backswing; Torgeson complained that Yvars was crowding the hitters; after Torgeson singled, Yvars broke his bat by pounding it on HP

ej,torge101,P,goetl901,Fighting ej,bickv101,P,goetl901,Arguing failure to eject opponent $as Earl Torgeson ran off the field, he learned that Sal Yvars had broken his bat; Torgeson ran into the Giants dugout and punched Yvars in the eye; the wound would require three stitches; both benches emptied, but no more punches were thrown.
